ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Fashion choices
ygData.msgSnippet: My bard s wearing pretty pathetic gear, only leather and soft wicker... hey, she s only level 10. Got the green pants and sleeves, rest is brown, no hat.
ygData.messageBody:
My bard's wearing pretty pathetic gear, only leather and soft
wicker... hey, she's only level 10. Got the green pants and
sleeves, rest is brown, no hat. Several people have complimented
me on the look. Dunno what I'll do when I get higher since I
can't stand the look of banded on a human (or just about any
female for that matter), bronze weighs a ton, and waiting until I
can get my lambent is an awfully long time to be wearing leather
even if it does look good. But after spending about 15 levels in
banded with my cleric (she's now 29 and working on quests for the
nice gold plate), I never want to look like a swimsuit model
again. Suggestions on good looking and relatively cheap gear for
an low level bard? (besides twinking. The poor cleric's broke as
it is, and I'm not too fond of twinking anyway.)

Rebecca Small wrote:

> I liked the color on lambent, especially when I had a mostly
> full suit on.
> When I started getting imbrued though, it didn't look as good.
> Then I got
> some kylong, and a hero bracer, and it was commented on several
> times that I
> was really multicolored. Now I have managed to go mostly green,
> between SS
> and dragon stuff from WW. Still have my silver helm (I love my
> hammerhead
> bucket!) and my imbrued boots to break the monotony of all
> green and it
> keeps me from looking like a ranger! I prefer green overall and
> don't see
> any major fashion shifts in the near future.
>
> Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe (hoping Ragefire pops soon so I can go back
> to Phin
> camping)
> Venator Sapentia, Xegony
